Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is grey in section and contains a number of small white inclusions, the interior is lightly spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of four lines of Demotic text written in black ink. The traces of Demotic text on the other side of the ostracon is illegible.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393800) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393800)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (no.15)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Dem. 15 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
